characters: NANETTE COLE. REMEMBER THAT WEEK IN VEGAS
BOB I WANNA TALK TO YOU HERE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darkness. We hear a klaxon. Red alert in space! Automatic doors slide open -- we follow a striding, confi man named CAPTAIN ROBERT DALY as he enters the BRIDGE of SPACESHIP. It's retro - the women wear miniskirts, the colour scheme groovy, the screens are old school -- like a 60s space ep Following behind DALY: comms officer SHANIA LOWERY. DALY glances up at the giant DISPLAY WINDSHIELD in front him. His matinee-idol looks and stance epitomise the very best of Space Fleet command. The DISPLAY shows an ALIEN WARSHIP looming in front of th WALTON (40s), the first officer and ship’s navigator, sal as DALY enters. Walton looks worried. Scared.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Captain Daly-

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Report.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: It’s a non-federation vessel - jumped straight out of whitespace, right in front of us. DALY nods to himself, then looks at the main display. Tightens his jaw. Walton steps in alongside.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Valdack.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: (horrified) It can’t be -- LIEUTENANT DUDANI, the ship's head engineer, who has CYBO IMPLANTS on his temples, looks up from a monitor.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: My datascan indicates a heavily- armoured Gorgon Dreadnaught, vessel ID number zero nine sixty fi--

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: (cutting in) Thank you Dudani. (beat) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Valdack must've hijacked it from the Fermi hub and tracked our position. (beat) Tulaska, shield status. ELENA TULASKA, the Callister's glamorous head of security a SEXY ALIEN -- sounds worried -- albeit in an EAST EUROP

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: Shields 100 percent.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Helmsman Packer-

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: Captain -

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Prime rear thrusters.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: Rear thrusters primed. Behind him HELMSMAN PACKER works furiously at the control WALTON is increasingly spooked. DALY is thinking.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: If that’s Valdack he’ll rip us to shreds! (beat) Captain we have to surrender. (beat) There’s no other way! DALY keeps his eyes on the display. Suddenly: VALDACK’s

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Let’s not lose our heads Lieutenant Walton. BOOM! -- the BRIDGE is ROCKED by a blast from ship.

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: Shields at 68%.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: Heavy damage reported decks six through ten-

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: Fires in med centre and major rupture to cargo bay Alpha.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: We got no choice Captain!

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: Do you want me to open comms with Valdack’s craft Captain? WALTON looks at DALY pleadingly. But...

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Negative. BOOM! Another blast rocks the bridge!

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: Shields at 54 percent.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: There’s no way out.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Captain -- please --

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Not now Walton- DALY peers beyond VALDACK’s ship. Beyond it: a cluster of asteroids encompassed in a large green gas cloud. He turns to PACKER, the young helmsman. CAPTAIN DALY (CONT’D) Helmsman Packer! Take us into that asteroid gas cluster.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: Into the cluster? WALTON looks terrified.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: That's suicide--

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: --It's our only chance! (beat) That gas cluster is charged with ionized pyron particles. If our shields hold we can use them to increase our photon intensity. DALY puts a hand up to silence DUDANI’s wittering. CAPTAIN DALY (CONT’D) Packer, increase thrusters.

1 PACKER pushes forward on the throttle. Engines roar. WALT looks increasingly scared. The CREW watch as their ship passes over the enemy craft heads into the gas cluster. The entire bridge SHUDDERS. Lights blink.

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: Shields at 43%

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: It'll tear the ship apart! Without averting his eyes from the display, DALY snaps:

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Walton, you're a Space Fleet officer. Hold yourself together. WALTON checks himself, nods, tries to hold it together. BOOM! SHUDDER! Another IMPACT.

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: Shields at 32%. SHANIA monitors the sensors from her station.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: Valdack's not following.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Packer, turn us around-— PACKER nods and obeys. CAPTAIN DALY (CONT’D) Tulaska, charge photon bolts. TULASKA taps something.

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: Bolts charged captain. A beat. Daly bides his time.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Fire. Then They fire a photon bolt at the enemy ship. It's a direct it EXPLODES ON IMPACT causing enormous damage.

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: His hull’s breached. Shields gone. He's defenceless.  USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 5.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: (to SHANIA) Lieutenant Lowery, open comms-—

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: He's already hailing us Captain --

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: On screen. The screen reveals VALDACK, a MUSCLY SPACE VIKING, injure but defiant. Behind him: glimpses of his spaceship throug sparks and smoke. The screen flickers - the signal is wea

dialogues.speaker: VALDACK
dialogues.text: (On comms screen) Captain Daly. May you drown in the venom of 900 Tragorian snakes.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: You're defeated, Valdack. Return the Plasmorthium crystal and we'll cause you no more damage. VALDACK spits.

dialogues.speaker: VALDACK
dialogues.text: You must think me a fool Captain. I know the crystal's capabilities. I'll die before I give it up.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: I gave you a chance Valdack. Showed you mercy. Reflect on that. While you can. (To SHANTA) Close comms. The display screen flicks back to open space. The semi- obliterated enemy ship sits in view.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tulaska. Destroy his ship.

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: Yes captain. A PHOTON BOLT is launched. The crew watches on as it impa the enemy ship. The ship EXPLODES IN A FIREBALL. The crew breathe a SIGH of relief - then CHEER. DALY stan

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: That was incredible captain.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: You saved our lives!  USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 6.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WALTON takes DALY's hand, desperately grateful.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Sorry I lost it back there.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Not for the first time, Walton-

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: I should know by now to never doubt you. Please -- forgive me. Still holding DALY’s hand, he falls down on one knee, lik man begging forgiveness from the pope.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: At ease, Walton. WALTON stands, nodding. Suddenly DUDANI pipes up:

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: Captain! Everyone looks round.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sensors indicate an escape pod ejected from Valdack's ship before detonation. Traces of Plasmorthium - - he’s escaping with the crystal.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: Want me to plot a pursuit course captain? DALY considers his options.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: No. We'll let him go. (beat) For now. Everyone nods and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: Great decision-making, captain. Suddenly WALTON shouts:

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Three cheers for Captain Daly! Hip- hip-

dialogues.speaker: CREW
dialogues.text: Hooray!  USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 7.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DALY pretends to be vaguely embarrassed, making a "quiet down" gesture with his hands. But the toasting continues:

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Hip hip!

dialogues.speaker: CREW
dialogues.text: Hooray! ++. so DALY smiles, shrugs, and basks in their adulation. Next, WALTON claps in time and leads a sing-song:

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: For he's a jolly good fellow... The entire CREW join in. DALY basks in the praise. SHANIA sidles up and puts an arm around his waist. DALY leans over and kisses her, SHANIA literally bending backwards as he does so. A curiously chaste lips-closed k The pose is a bit like Errol Flynn kissing a rescued maid No sooner has the kiss with SHANIA finished than DALY tur and performs an IDENTICAL KISS with TULASKA. Throughout, the crew are still SINGING his praises.

dialogues.speaker: CREW
dialogues.text: And so say all of us! And so say all of us! For he's a jolly good fell-o-www... And so say all of us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elevator doors open to reveal DALY waiting inside - he lo different. Downtrodden. In badly-fitting work attire, thi the real ROBERT DALY, arriving at his real job. DALY steps into the lobby. We don't really see the RECEPTIONIST's face just yet incidentally. Behind her is the logo for the company - CALLISTER INC. On one wall is a video display showing a sizzle reel of t company's major product: INFINITY. It's a constant trail showing CGI graphics from a space g The rendering looks like the environment aboard the USS CALLISTER, but without the retro tinge -- it's more JJ AB style. And it's intercut with captions like “MASSIVELY MULTIPLAYER VR SPACE EPIC” and "TOTALLY IMMERSIVE". DALY reaches the main doors, swipes his pass, and the pan BEEPS and flashes RED. He tries again. Same result.  USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 8.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DALY looks over at the RECEPTIONIST. We notice she is LIEUTENANT ELENA TULASKA, the USS CALLISTER's head of security, except she's in civilian clothes. DALY's demeanour is notably different. He's awkward. Shy.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: Elena? My pass doesn’t work again. She looks up, not hugely interested in his dilemma.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: You must renew on first of each month.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: I know, but, the first was on the weekend, so...

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Okay - She presses a button, unlocking the main doors.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: (looking at phone) You’re welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALY makes his way across the large open plan office - th is CALLISTER INC head quarters, an advanced VR Tech compa We see rows of coders at workstations, designing software Building levels. Data streaming down paper thin monitors some using AR smart-specs -- it’s Google on steroids. In one small room we see some TESTERS sitting motionless, their eyes clouded out, with tiny disc-like VR EXPERIENCE stuck to their temples. One of the walls serves as a huge video display -- also showing the INFINITY sizzle reel. Another face we recognise heads towards DALY on his way o It's HELMSMAN PACKER, the fresh faced recruit, only here is an intern, real name NATE PACKER. He smiles a greeting DALY as he nears. He’s casually carrying an empty tray.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Morning Mr. Daly.  USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 9.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: Helmsman Packer. NATE looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: DALY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean, Mr. Packer. Nate. Nate smiles, a bit confused, and passes. DALY turns, real where he's going. Points at the tray.

dialogues.speaker: DALY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you - making coffees? Nate stops, turns.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Uh yeah. DALY waits for a brief moment for Nate to catch up with w he meant by the question. Nate doesn't get there.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: Do you think maybe you could make me one too? I mean perhaps --

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Sure. Sure. Nate takes out his phone, ready to add to the order.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: Vanilla latte. Nate types.

dialogues.speaker: DALY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Skim milk. Nate smirks at that, glancing at DALY's paunch.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Yeah good call. DALY forces a smile. Nate finishes taking the order, smil heads off on his mission. DALY turns and walks across the floor, momentarily distra by the sight of SHANIA LOWERY (who works here in BUSINESS AFFAIRS) crossing the floor in business-wear.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: (finishing a cell call, cut-glass accent) Well, careful what you wish for; those are big numbers and we might just have to hold you to that. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat; hearing unfunny joke from client) Hahaha! (beat) Of course. Absolutely... Momentarily not looking where he's going, DALY immediatel trips over a GYM BAG and lands with a THUMP on the floor. There's a moment for him to groan. All eyes on him. A man who looks exactly like VALDACK leans in to help him But this VALDACK is actually a faintly jockish co-worker, KARL, from marketing.

dialogues.speaker: KARL
dialogues.text: Woah, you okay there? DALY gets to his feet, embarrassed. Feeling all eyes on h

dialogues.speaker: KARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Guess you didn't see my gym bag. KARL slaps him on the back, a little too hard

dialogues.speaker: KARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry bud. DALY smiles weakly, and heads toward the end of the room. DALY passes a BIG office window - we see SOMEONE inside talking to SOMEONE on a hands-free earpiece, while toying idly with a STRESS BALL with the CALLISTER logo on it. This man is confident, swaggering -- he glances over at D smiles and nods as he carries on his conversation. It's WALTON, the USS CALLISTER'S second in command - in the re world he looks far more confident. On the wall of WALTON’s office is a blown-up framed front cover of WIRED magazine. It shows WALTON, with the headli TO INFINITY AND BEYOND. DALY smiles and waves as he passes the window but WALTON' attention has already gone back to his chat. DALY carries on, passes text on the door that reads; JAMES WALTON. CEO. CALLISTER INC. He reaches a second, pokier office next to WALTON'S and h inside. On his door the text reads; ROBERT DALY. CHIEF TECHNICAL OFFICER. CALLISTER INC.  USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALY's office is cramped. On the wall there's a POSTER fo SPACE FLEET, an old late 60s TV SHOW in the STAR TREK mou Bits of SPACE FLEET memorabilia are everywhere. There's e a series of BLU-RAY, DVD and VHS box sets on a shelf. DALY sits at his desk. Sighs. He looks through the glass to notice SHANIA and KARL. Fro the glances in his direction it looks like maybe they're talking about him. SHANIA laughs at whatever KARL just sa Under the desk, DALY clenches a fist. A knock at the door snaps him out of it. NANETTE COLE (mi 20s), supersmart coder, stands in the doorway, a tad nerv DALY thinks he knows what she wants. It's happened before

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: Ladies bathroom's that way. The sign's confusing.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: You're Robert Daly, right?

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: Right -- NANETTE steps forward and holds out a hand.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Nanette, Nanette Cole. DALY gingerly takes her hand and shakes it

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I started here today, coding on the update? Just wanted to pass on my admiration to the person who actually designed Infinity. The procedural algorithm is amazing, it really is some beautiful code. DALY is genuinely taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: Thank you. NANETTE steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: It's actually the reason I wanted to work here.  USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 12.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A pregnant pause, DALY doesn't know what else to say.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You must be busy, sorry.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: No-no, its fine-

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: -Fangirling, sorry. She notices the SPACE FLEET boxsets. Picks up a VHS case.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Woah what's that? (beat) Vintage. DALY stands, worried his VHS case may get fingermarks on

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: Space Fleet. A TV show. It was before your time - before my time actually, but it was visionary --

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Is that on like tape? DALY taps the other boxsets

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: Got the VHS, the DVD, the Blu-Rays - - whole thing, seasons one to six. (beat) Netflix has it these days.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: “Aboard the spaceship USS Callister”. OK yeah, so Callister is like the-

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: Yeah, when we set up the company I suggested we call it Callister as a kind of a tribute. Walton didn’t really get the reference, but he let me have that one. Nanette looks at the SPACE FLEET poster. Notes the female crew member in a sort of mini-skirt costume.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Mini-skirted damsels? Little cold for that in space.  USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 13.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: That's just what a Bargradian sand warrior would say. The look on NANETTE’s face indicates she didn’t get the j Suddenly WALTON enters without invitation. Starts talking before he even realizes NANETTE is in the room.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Bob, Christmas is closing in like a god damn meteor and we got customers all over our balls waiting on this Infinity update. Just tell me it’1ll be up and running before the weekend.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: (flustered) Well - I can ask Kabir if he could pick the pace up a little-

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: (interrupting) You're CTO, you shouldn't be asking anyone anything. You should be telling. Like I'm telling you now.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: I'll speak to him. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Good. Okay. DALY nods. WALTON notices NANETTE standing in the room. Desperately wishing she wasn't there.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Hi. Sorry. I couldn't find a good moment to - She's about to say the word "leave".

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: You must be new. (Holds out his hand) James Walton, I run the company. WALTON holds her hand a little too long after the shake.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, we run the company. Kind of. Bobby's the hardware and I'm - the shiny front end.  USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 14.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Nanette Cole.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Which department?

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Engine architecture.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Did you start today?

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Ier - yes.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: You had the tour?

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: No. I was just--

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: (Cutting in) --Then please, allow me. Before NANETTE can answer WALTON leads her out the door.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: (To DALY) It was so nice to meet you. DALY nods. Then watches as WALTON leads NANETTE away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALY walks over to a workstation to find KABIR DUDANI, a bookish coder, eating his breakfast at his desk.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: Uh, Kabir... As DUDANI looks up, we realise he’s LT DUDANI. He wears GLASSES in reality.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: Mr Daly?

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: You got the latest ETA on the update patch? Just there’s still some runtime errors...  USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 15.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: Well... thing is Mr Daly - it could be ready by end of play today, but if we had time we could alter the trading mechanics, tweak the critical hit system, but of course that’d add another week, maybe ten days? While DUDANI says that, DALY glances round and sees, on t other side of the office, WALTON introducing NANETTE to SHANIA and KARL. KARL is clearly attracted to her. DALY didn't hear what DUDANI just said. DUDANI prompts hi

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mr Daly?

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah, do all that. Thank you. DUDANI nods, a bit surprised.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: Okay. We’re on it. DALY heads back towards his office. As he does, he sees t intern Nate handing out his coffees. One to SHANIA, one t KARL. One to WALTON. Nate has one left -- DALY's skinny latte. WALTON takes it hands it to NANETTE. She smiles and accepts it. DALY scowls. Retreats to his office and broods in silence

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is dark. No one home. A sensor panel on the wall suddenly emits a little BING noise as DALY enters, grouch Eating the remains of a hot dog, holding a GROCERY BAG un his arm. As he enters the lights gently brighten to an inviting gl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a small room with even more SPACE FLEET memorabil Posters. Action figures in glass display cases. An Airfix model of VALDACK's ship, still in its packaging. There's also a small desk with a computer MONITOR and keyboard, and a high-backed ergonomic chair. On the desk there is also a MYSTERIOUS DEVICE, like a PET DISH connected to a wire that trails off somewhere.  USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 16.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DALY slumps at his desk and drops the hot dog packaging i a small trash can. DALY reaches over to the side of his desk, opens a mini- fridge next to it, and tries to choose between a carton o CHOCOLATE MILK and a carton of STRAWBERRY MILK. As he does so, we notice in the FRIDGE DOOR is a see-thro ziplock plastic bag with a RED LOLLIPOP inside it. The name TOMMY is written on the bag in Sharpie. DALY chooses CHOCOLATE milk. Stabs a straw into the carto and taps his mouse. He takes a small VR EXPERIENCER DISC from a receptacle an plants it on his temple. On the monitor, using his mouse, he opens a DESKTOP FOLDE labelled INFINITY. Inside are two icons. INFINITY and INFINITY (SPACE FLEET MOD). He double-clicks the latter. LIGHTS GLIMMER on his VR EXPERIENCER DISC. Immediately DALY's EYES GLAZE OVER and his body goes limp He slumps back in his chair, immobilised - he's in the ga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors open. The in-game CAPTAIN DALY -- energized and simmering -- steps out onto the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Welcome back Captain.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Have you located Valdack's position?

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Not yet. But our sensors are probing every star system between here and--

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: So your answer is "no". A pause. Tension rises on the bridge. The captain's in a mood. The crew exchange glances.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: I'm afraid so captain.  USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 17.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DALY nods. Then he suddenly grasps WALTON by the throat a lifts him off the ground with one arm. Darth Vader style. The CREW watch, frozen with fear. WALTON gasps for breath

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: You're pathetic Walton. What are you?

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: (strangulated) Pt-- pthhh-

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: (as clearly as possible) Pathetic. DALY lets him dangle a moment longer, then lets go. WALTO hits the floor gasping. DALY addresses the rest of the cr

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: (to everyone) So Valdack’s out there, somewhere and you village idiots are asleep at the wheel. (beat) You're not just disgraceful. You’re disgusting. All of you. Silence as they look at their shoes. CAPTAIN DALY (CONT’D) So. Can you do one thing? Can you find Valdack? (glancing at WALTON) I’m not asking. I’m telling you. (beat; to all) Understand? General nodding and murmurs of ‘of course Captain’. CAPTAIN DALY (CONT’D) Well alright. Daly clicks his fingers -- more energy. CAPTAIN DALY (CONT’D) (to TULASKA) Tulaska! Check security protocols - if they've expired you're in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: Yes Captain.  10 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 18.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TULASKA nods, chastened, busies herself.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: (to DUDANT) Dudani! Recheck those probe results! No room for errors.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: Of course captain. DALY turns to PACKER.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Helmsman Packer -

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: Yes Captain?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Vanilla latte. Skim milk. PACKER salutes.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: At once! PACKER practically sprints to fetch the order. Meanwhile settles down into the captain's chair. He looks at WALTON, who's crawling on all fours towards t door.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Walton. WALTON swallows, crawls over to the CAPTAIN's chair. Lies down in front of it. DALY rests his feet on WALTON's back DALY sitting in his chair, sighs. CAPTAIN DALY (CONT’D) (out loud) Exit game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The real DALY blinks back to life in his chair. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANETTE sits coding at her workstation, ear buds in. We pull focus to see DALY is watching her from his glass  10 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 19.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Now we're inside Daly’s box, looking out. Just like him. Then DALY spots WALTON. Striding through the office like Caesar. He stops at NANETTE's desk. She pops out her ear buds. They trade a little friendly c Walton puts a friendly hand on Nanette's shoulder. Daly's eyes tighten. Suddenly he's snapped out of this reverie by DUDANI's voi DALY looks up -- DUDANI is in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: Mr Daly? Got that new ETA on the update patch.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: New ETA? ——

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: It’s all good but now we’re looking at December 24th for roll out.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: We don’t patch till Christmas Eve?

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: Well. Yeah. I mean with the alterations you approved... DALY doesn’t know how to respond to this.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay thank you. He watches DUDANI go. Then NANETTE is in his doorway:

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Hey Robert. DALY stands up.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: Oh hi --

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Just fixing a coffee, you want one? It’s the nicest thing anyone's said to him in five years.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: Sure. (beat) Uh, vanilla latte. Skim milk.  10 11 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 20.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Okey dokes! She walks off. DALY's heart swells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANETTE stands at the HYDRATION STATION -- a glorified wa cooler area the company has installed. Various branded vending and coffee machines line a seating area. Meanwhile, SHANIA approaches from a distance, on a cellph call. Again, she talks in her cut-glass British accent.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: (friendly, to phone) Of course. Yes. Absolutely. Using cardboard cups with plastic lids, NANETTE starts to herself her coffee and one for DALY, when SHANIA arrives alongside her. As Shania speaks, she looks at Nanette -- and mimes bored and irritation with the phonecall she’s making, so Nanett will know she secretly hates the person on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yes. Okay then. Hahaha! Well those are great numbers! Ta-ta. Shania hangs up, looks at Nanette and points at the phone Her accent changes. SHANIA sounds less refined in real li

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (pointing at phone) Total fucking shitwit. Nanette nods, a bit embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: You want a coffee?

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: Yeah thanks, Brushed Suede. NANETTE punches buttons. They wait while their coffees br SHANIA regards her and picks up an apple. NANETTE smiles, unable to think of much to say.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So how you settling in? You are settling in? She takes a bite.  11 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 21.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Yeah, everyone's really friendly. Shania nods and chews the apple.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not like my last job, thank God.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: It was a toxic workplace. Boss was a major league bully. Not like here, like with Mr--?

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: -Walton? Yeah he’s a good guy. (beat) Bit of a player...

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Oh?

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: - like chuck a ham sandwich across the room and he'd fuck it before it hit the ground but he’s basically an alright bloke. NANETTE doesn’t know how to respond to that.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Okay. Well. It's two bosses anyway here I guess. SHANIA looks blank.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: Two how?

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Robert Daly --

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: Oh! Ha! Well technically yeah. And just now we reveal that DALY is lurking just behind t refreshment area, listening in, unbeknownst to both women

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Mr. Daly’s actually the reason I came here. I mean, who wouldn’t want to work under an incredible mind like that, y’know? His coding is sublime.  USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 22. ul CONTINUED: (2) ql We see DALY hearing this praise. His heart skips a beat.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: Do you have a thing for him?

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Daly? No, it’s not like that. It’s purely professional. I like his code. We see DALY hearing this. No reaction on his face.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: (breathes out) Fucking hell, I was gonna say -- don't be too nice to him. He gets a bit... starey. Y’know. She does the mime as she says that bit.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wide berth, that’s my advice. Wide berth...

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: (a bit disappointed) Oh. Okay. (beat) Thank you. NANETTE puts lids on the coffees as SHANIA eats her apple

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's now muted and awkward as NANETTE carries the COFFEE in to DALY and sets it down on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: There you go.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: Thank you. Nanette goes, feeling DALY's eyes on her back. She sits a her own desk and SIPS HER COFFEE. A CLOSE-UP on her LIPS as she sips through the LID SIPPY- HOLE. DALY is WATCHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun begins to set.  14 15 16 17 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The office is almost empty bar DALY, still in his office. He watches the last few employees leaving. KARL, pulling coat, chatting to SHANIA, leaves through the doors. NANETTE hoists a backpack onto her back and puts her earb in. She's the last to leave. The moment the door shuts behind her, DALY stands up. He opens a desk drawer containing SURGICAL GLOVES, TWEEZE and a SEE-THRU PLASTIC BAG. He starts pulling on the gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALY is at NANETTE's WORKSTATION. He reaches into her TRASH CAN. Pulls out the COFFEE CUP she had earlier. Takes off the L Carefully places the LID into the SEE-THRU BAG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BONG. The room lights up in preparation for DALY'S return DALY bursts in, fumbling at his work bag. He pulls out th cellophane bag we saw earlier and hurries into his bedroo INT. DALY’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM - NIGHT 17 DALY rushes to his desk, sits, puts down the cellophane b He dons latex gloves again. Pops open the MYSTERIOUS DEVI on the desk. There's a PETRI DISH in there with some sort thick blue gel in it. He carefully takes the CUP LID out of the plastic bag and runs a SWAB along the SIPPY-HOLE. DALY delicately places the SWAB onto the PETRI DISH and closes the lid. An LED winks. Something bleeps. Then he places the LID back into the BAG and puts the BAG into the FRIDGE. We notice the shelves have OTHER ITEMS i bags -- one contains a splodge of CHEWING GUM, another a TISSUE, and one a LOLLIPOP. He turns to his keyboard and types. Clicks his mouse arou  17 18 19 20 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 24.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: More LIGHTS on the PETRI DISH DEVICE start to twinkle. On the screen: ASSIMILATING. And a loading bar appears. 1% and rising.

dialogues.speaker: ESTIMATED TIME TO COMPLETION
dialogues.text: DALY looks at his watch. Stretches. Heads for bed as the loading bar rises incrementally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orange morning sun spreads over Daly's apartment block. INT. DALY’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM - MORNING 19 The loading bar reads 67% as DALY, in the background, get dressed and heads out the door. Music carries us through a little montage:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALY exits the elevator, crosses the lobby and tries his pass. Once again he's rejected. ELENA the RECEPTIONIST buzzes him in again. We INTERCUT the following with the LOADING BAR as it clim Now it's at 74% Next we see him watching NANETTE chatting with WALTON, th KARL, then SHANIA. The loading bar climbs to 85% DALY sits typing when WALTON suddenly holds an iPad-type tablet displaying a press article directly in between him the monitor. Headline: INFINITY UPDATE: NOT TILL XMAS? DALY looks up at him. WALTON shakes his head, disappointe Meanwhile NANETTE is at her station, coding. Loading bar now at 96% We go in on NANETTE's face.
We see DALY watching her through the glass.  20 21 22 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a starched white MEDICAL BED in this room. We are tight on eyes. A woman's eyes. Nanette's eyes. Suddenly NANETTE wakes, looks around. This isn't her bed. Or her room. It’s too dark to make out detail. There's no window. Just some machines making beeping-booping noises She looks down and realises she's dressed in SPACE FLEET attire. Figure-hugging uniform. Groovy short skirt. She pats herself, confused. Feels her hair. It's differen She walks to a door, which opens into a corridor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR an automatic door swooshing. Then NANETTE walks i frame, traversing a classic starship corridor.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: (Calling out) Hello? There's no-one here. She turns a corner. At the end is a of AIRLOCK DOOR with a small porthole-type WINDOW in it. She sees her own FACE reflected in it. But it’s not a reflection she entirely recognises. Her hair is different It's styled. And she has make-up on. Light blue eyeshadow She stares at herself, baffled. And then -- she focuses o the stars behind her reflection. THE STARS?!? Shocked, she leans in. OUT THE WINDOW - stretching out either side of the window the UNIVERSE. DEEP SPACE. We see an external shot. NANETTE peering out from a tiny window. We pull out to see, on the main section of the sh printed in giant letters, the words USS CALLISTER Dizzy with shock, NANETTE steps back from the window. And then she hears TWO VOICES arguing, echoing down the hallw She stumbles towards them in a trance, following the soun through the winding hallways until she reaches a DOOR. NANETTE passes through the door -- onto the BRIDGE.  23 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BRIDGE is dimly lit. The crew are not at their statio They're in a corner, huddled around a kind of BAR. WALTON's there, pouring a drink whilst the rest sit solem watching. The argument (between WALTON and TULASKA) stops minute they see NANETTE in the doorway. There's a pause.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: (to self) Oh boy. (beat) Looks like there's a new girl in the office. He takes a swig. NANETTE holds back, confused. SHANIA pip up -- in her ‘regular’ voice, not her cut-glass accent.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: What’s your name hun?

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Come in. Let me pour you a drink. Got everything from Bengarian phlegm shots to distilled root blood from the Cangor quadrant. What's your poison? Some of this actually is poison. Don't be shy. NANETTE doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Am I dreaming?

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: ‘Fraid not. TULASKA, who’s bored and sitting at her station, doesn’t up from her fingernails.

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: I remember dreaming. PACKER nods -- those were the days.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Where am I?  23 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 27.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: The USS Callister, Space Fleet's finest, exploring the farthest reaches of the known universe and beyond. We are its loyal crew. And now, it seems, so are you. Cheers. WALTON downs a shot. NANETTE looks around.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: Your name, babes, what’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Nanette. (off SHANIA’s blank look) We've met.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: Maybe, in the real world. I got no way of knowing.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: You'd better sit down.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: I don't want to sit down, I want to know what's going on. DUDANI walks towards her.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: You're onboard Robert Daly's ship.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Wh -- Robert Daly? The CTO?

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: (Pouring another drink) Here he's Captain Daly, our fearless leader.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: You're seriously gonna need to sit the fuck down. NANETTE turns to spot PACKER.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: (To PACKER) You're the intern? From work. Nate something?  23 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 28.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: Packer. Nate Packer. (beat) I’m still just the intern out there huh? Jesus. NANETTE turns to DUDANI.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: And you’re --

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: Kabir Dudani. Diagnostics. NANETTE, dazed, looks at TULASKA.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: You're the receptionist. TULASKA nods.

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: Elena. NANETTE looks at TULASKA’s ALIEN BLUE SKIN.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: But you’re skin is blue... TULASKA looks at her own alien skin and practically shrug way of recognition.

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: Weird alien skin, I know, it’s fucked up. Almost sort of racist. NANETTE looks dizzy. She nearly falls over. SHANIA is the to catch her. She starts leading NANETTE over to the captain's chair.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: Walt. Fix her something. Vodka. Something she'll recognise. NANETTE sits. The rest of the officers crowd round. She l at them like she’s dreaming.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: What's it like out there now? NANETTE struggles to answer.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Like what year is it? SHANIA is annoyed with PACKER.  USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 29.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: What year - I saw you today.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Did you see me? Did I look thin? Like wheatgrass and yoga thin?

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: Can we not pop her fucking mind? Give her a chance.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Someone needs to be straight with me right now. SHANIA steps forward. Trying to calm her.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: Okay. Listen. This is Infinity. That's what we're all inside-- (gesturing around) -- that's where all this exists.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Infinity the game?

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: (nodding) Daly's got his own modded version of Infinity - re-skinned to look like his favourite TV show --

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Space... Thing... WALTON brings the vodka over and hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Space Fleet. Hence the groovy decor-

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: (indicating own outfit) And this get-up.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Infinity's an online game, like a multiplayer deal, I mean --

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: This is his development build. Sealed off. So he can control it. He keeps it offline so the custom code he's written can’t be detected and deleted.  USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 30.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: It’s a bubble universe ruled by an asshole God. NANETTE is almost lost for words.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: He -- put us in here?

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: (nodding) Drink your vodka.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: How do we get out? SHANIA holds the shot of vodka closer.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: Really, drink it. NANETTE downs the shot. And gasps.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can't leave.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: What! ?

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: None of us can. Because you're not actually you.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: I know, it’s mental. But -- you're a copy of you.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: A digital clone. NANETTE looks around, trying to process this. WALTON sympathetically signals for her to drink another shot.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: No. I'm me-

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: - but not the real you.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: Daly's created an identical digital version of you - of all of us. From your DNA. He’1l have harvested it somehow.  23 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 31.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Told me he got mine from the rim of a smoothie cup. Packer’s juices he retrieved from the bathroom--

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: -- man, let that go, she don’t need details-

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: Basically he’s built some fucking gizmo-

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: -I theorize an advanced biometric DNA virtual clone replicator wi--

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: (interrupting) - exactly, a fucking gizmo. He fed your DNA in, grew you inside his computer and bam. You pop up here. Like a pop tart. NANETTE looks dizzy. SHANIA continues.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We've all been through it. He brings us in for different reasons. Shit we did in the office. I called him out for staring.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: I reset admin permissions on a test build for fourteen minutes. In truth a minor error which was rapidly- Before DUDANI can ramble, PACKER cuts in:

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: I brought him the wrong sandwich. TULASKA puts a hand up.

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: “Insufficient smiling”. WALTON doesn’t want to talk about this.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Never mind Daly's ‘reasons’. We're stuck in his playground now, that’s all you need to know. NANETTE gets out of the chair and walks around.  USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 32.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: This is a dream. It has to be. WALTON takes the shot that NANETTE has left.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: More of an eternal waking nightmare from which there is no escape.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: No. No.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: (to WALTON) Fuck sake, I’m trying to break her in gently. WALTON rolls his eyebrows and downs the shot.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Quicker she gets it, the easier it’1l be for her. Suddenly the lights of the ship come on, bathing the room a warm orange glow. Tense resignation washes across the c

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: Daddy's home.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: (indicating lights) Daly. He’ll be here any moment.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: No. I'm out of here. PACKER grabs her arm. Deathly serious.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: (To NANETTE) You gotta stay on the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Get off-

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: He controls everything -- he does

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: shit to make us cooperate. You have no idea. I’m trying to help you. NANETTE pulls herself free and RUNS for the exit. PACKER to run after her, but SHANIA stops him by saying:

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: Leave it.  23 24 25 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 33.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: (to SHANTA) He'll fuck us all up if she doesn't play ball.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: She’s gonna have to work it out for herself. Like we all did. She glances at WALTON who looks at his shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANETTE runs along the hallway, looking for an escape.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: (to self) Gotta be a way out. She tries an access panel beside the airlock door. It has buttons on it. She mashes away at them.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on come on. Got to be a way -- Suddenly, the ship HUMS LOUDER. Lights up. NANETTE tries the access panel again, but stops when she notices something happening to her hands -- they're glowi She holds them up, realises its happening to her whole bo She is beginning to disintegrate in a strange golden glow She panics, SCREAMS as she evaporates into thin air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANETTE reappears on the teleporter, in the same golden g she disappeared in, still holding her hands out, SCREAMIN The CREW are now all at their stations watching her in silence. In the quiet of the bridge, NANETTE'S SCREAMING seems overly dramatic. She stops. The chair in the centre of the room spins round to face h revealing CAPTAIN DALY sat in a classic hero pose.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Cole. Welcome aboard. She stares at him, agape. CAPTAIN DALY (CONT’D) Crew, we have a new member of the team. Science Officer Nanette Cole. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN DALY (CONT’D) (beat) Please, take your post - I believe we've finally managed to track Valdack to an uncharted planet. TULASKA, the nearest, nudges her. Signals to an empty cha

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: (Gathering composure) No. Nervous looks from the CREW.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Take your post. That is an order.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: I'm not doing this.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: (Dropping the act briefly) The whole thing's much better if you let yourself get into it.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: If you think I'm playing along with your Space Force bullshit--

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Space Fleet -

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: - whatever - just think again. CAPTAIN DALY's mood darkens. He stands from his chair.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: This is my ship. I am your captain. An order is an order.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Then go fuck yourself. "Sir". A stand off. The tension amongst the crew is palpable.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Okay. So we're doing it this way. CAPTAIN DALY holds out a hand in her direction, not unlik the Emperor from Empire Strikes Back.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: What, you gonna 'throw a fireball'? The crew avert their eyes. They've seen this before. Suddenly DALY clicks his fingers.  25 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 35.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NANETTE's entire FACE suddenly becomes a perfectly smooth featureless bump. No eyes, no nostrils, no mouth. We hear a muffled gasping. Evidently she can't breathe.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Oh dear. Can't see, can’t breathe? NANETTE is gasping -- but has no mouth. She pats her usel non-face, she clutches her throat, falls to her knees. The rest of the CREW return to their stations, trying to ignore the familiarity of the torture playing out. DALY comes closer, standing over her. CAPTAIN DALY (CONT’D) Unpleasant, isn't it? She's on the floor, gasping. DALY kneels beside her. CAPTAIN DALY (CONT’D) Do you submit? You won't die you know. No-one dies in here unless I want them to. I can keep you this way forever if I feel like it. Eternity - in darkness, gasping for breath with a mouth that isn't there. She writhes, desperate to breathe. DALY straightens up. CAPTAIN DALY (CONT’D) Do you submit? NANETTE is still squirming. CAPTAIN DALY (CONT’D) We have all the time in the universe. Do you submit? Eventually -- NANETTE nods. CAPTAIN DALY (CONT’D) Good girl. He clicks his fingers, walks away. NANETTE's face reappea She GULPS down air like someone rescued from drowning. CAPTAIN DALY spins his chair round away from NANETTE to f the large viewing screen at the front of the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Cole. Valdack's hideout. Triangulate the signal please.  25 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 36.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NANETTE looks at the crew. No one is coming to help her. They've all been made subservient by DALY's omnipotence. Eventually NANETTE pulls herself up, heads over to her station. She sits at the chair next to SHANIA. NANETTE looks down at the controls, incomprehensible symb and colored shapes. SHANIA talks through the side of her mouth to NANETTE.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: (Whispering) Any button, they're all the same. NANETTE looks down to see a red flashing light on her controls. She presses it. The shapes and symbols move away to reveal an animation o star system, it zeroes in on a planet in that system. A flashing beacon pulses on the planet surface. Informati scrolls down next to it. NANETTE stares at it all.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: (Reading from monitor) I’m getting a signal from... a class 5 planet... Uh.. Rannotch B...

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: Rannoch--

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Right. Rannoch B.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Excellent. Dudani, prepare the transmat system.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: Of course Captain. CAPTAIN DALY gets up.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Walton. Packer. Lowery. With me. We'll transport down to the planet. Reclaim the crystal. Bring Valdack to justice. The named crew members get up to follow CAPTAIN DALY to t TELEPORTER. CAPTAIN DALY stops:  25 26 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 37.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Actually, Cole. You come too. Perfect opportunity for you to prove you're more than a recommendation from Space Fleet. What do you say? NANETTE looks at TULASKA, who nods slowly and discreetly. PACKER, WALTON and DALY don BELTS with PHASER GUNS on the Meanwhile NANETTE joins them on the TELEPORTER. SHANIA indicates how to stand on one of the teleporter discs. CAPTAIN DALY (CONT’D) Mr Dudani. Transport!

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: Aye aye captain. He hits a button and the CREW DEMATERIALISES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The alien planet surface. Two suns hang in a mauve sky. DALY and the crew MATERIALISE into view. NANETTE looks a little dizzy. The rest are accustomed to it.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Breathable atmosphere. Scanning for Plasmorthian traces. DALY scans the horizon with his OMINICORDER, like it’s a geiger counter. The OMNICORDER beeps. Daly turns and points at the horizo CAPTAIN DALY (CONT’D) The crystal's this way. Let's go. He leads them toward it. DALY and WALTON walking ahead. As PACKER heads off, NANETTE spots the GUN on his belt.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: (hushed) Nate. She pulls level with him.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey Nate--

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: (equally hushed) Helmsman Packer. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: PACKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You gotta call me “Helmsman Packer”. He gets mad if we don't use our full titles.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: You got a gun, let’s take him out--

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: Not gonna happen --

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: It’s worth a shot--

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: One, our guns don’t work. Only his does. And two, the motherfucker's invincible.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Least you got a gun. She’s getting more and more annoyed with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALY leads them down a craggy path with high rocky walls towards the centre of a crater. NANETTE looks up around t it feels like they’re being watched. Some small stones clatter down the wall behind them making WALTON jump.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: (nervously) Captain-- DALY is consumed by the readings on his OMNICORDER.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Shhh! SUDDENLY VALDACK'S voice booms out from behind them.

dialogues.speaker: VALDACK, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: We meet again, Captain Daly! DALY swings around to see VALDACK standing on the crater’ edge above them, holding a massive grenade launcher, cove their only exit.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: We're trapped! DALY raises his phaser.

dialogues.speaker: VALDACK
dialogues.text: Not advisable. My plasma grenades would turn you into screaming soup.  27 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 39.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SHANIA leans in, whispers:

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: He’s not going to kill us Captain. He had the element of surprise, he'd have done it when he had the chance. DALY nods. Looks at VALDACK and raises his voice:

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Haven't worked out how to use the crystal, have you Valdack?

dialogues.speaker: VALDACK
dialogues.text: It's true that I require your Space Fleet knowledge. It’s also true that you'll give it to me.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Don’t be so sure. VALDACK gives out a classic evil villain laugh.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: (under breath; it’s cheesy) Jesus. SHANIA shoots her an urgent look -- be quiet.

dialogues.speaker: VALDACK
dialogues.text: Let’s see how your resolve holds up when you're being devoured one-by- one -- by my Archanajax. AT THAT MOMENT a grotesque BEETLE MONSTER scuttles from behind VALDACK, over the edge towards the crew. It's abou the size of a large HORSE with great big gnashing mandibl

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: We're all gonna die!

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Killing us won't make us tell you how the crystal works Valdack. We'll never -- Suddenly his OMNICORDER emits a sort of electronic BING B Like a doorbell. He holds it up. CAPTAIN DALY (CONT’D) (breaking character) Hold on - think my pizza's here. (beat; raised voice) Pause game.  27 28 29 30 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 40.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Suddenly DALY freezes in position, still holding the OMNICORDER. The crew RELAX. So does VALDACK. Even the ARACHNAJAX sits down. NANETTE is confused.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: You heard him, he's paused the game for a pizza delivery. (off incredulous look) Out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The REAL DALY snaps out of his trance -- his pupils retur to normal -- and peels the VR DISC off his temple. The same Bing Bong his omnicorder made is coming from somewhere off-screen.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: Hold on! He gets out of his seat.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: DALY takes a PIZZA box from a bored delivery guy. Flips o the lid and grabs a slice as he walks back to his bedroom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANETTE stares at CAPTAIN DALY, who's frozen in position, eyes open, still holding the OMNICORDER. She waves a hand front of his face. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: Watch out. He'll be back soon. VALDACK stretches and puts down his plasma launcher.

dialogues.speaker: VALDACK
dialogues.text: Goddam launcher's heavy as shit. (nodding down to CREW) How you guys holding up? SHANIA shrugs and rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: We're existing. WALTON nods at the ARACHNAJAX.  30 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 4l.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How ‘bout you Gillian? The ARACHNAJAX lets out a mournful howl.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, yeah. SHANIA sees NANETTE is now staring at the ARACHNAJAX. She leans in.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: Her name's Gillian. She was in marketing.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: Daly turned her into... that... cuz she wouldn't "play along" when he cloned her into here.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: This whole universe is littered with things like her. Poor fuckers who stepped out of line. NANETTE stares at the ARACHNAJAX sadly, and with a deeper sense of dread. Suddenly DALY's omnicorder emits a beep.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Well, here comes Captain Dick- The crew re-assume positions. VALDACK picks up his launch The ARACHNAJAX gets back on its feet. DALY springs back into life, calling up to VALDACK.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: If we die, the secret of the crystal dies with us Valdack!

dialogues.speaker: VALDACK
dialogues.text: So be it! The ARACHNAJAX advances toward them, gnashing its jaws.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Oh my God! We're going to die! DALY calls up one more time.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Valdack!

dialogues.speaker: VALDACK
dialogues.text: What is it Captain? Final words? DALY points to something to the far side of VALDACK.  30 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 42.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Over there -- a naked lady!

dialogues.speaker: VALDACK
dialogues.text: Whaaat? VALDACK turns to look. DALY raises his phaser and FIRES, hitting VALDACK in the shoulder. With a howl, VALDACK topples off the crater wall and land his back on the sandy floor. The ARACHNAJAX scuttles away. DALY and the CREW advance u the winded VALDACK as he groans in agony.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: Great plan Captain.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: Unparalleled tactics. Daly stands over VALDACK, who is alive -- barely.

dialogues.speaker: VALDACK
dialogues.text: (coughing up blood) We have fought many battles haven't we Captain?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: We have.

dialogues.speaker: VALDACK
dialogues.text: And I have been a good adversary for you have I not? CAPTAIN DALY nods.

dialogues.speaker: VALDACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then please. End it. Kill me. VALDACK looks DALY square in the eyes. He looks - despera CAPTAIN DALY considers the request. Aims his phaser at VALDACK's head, ready to fire the killshot. The rest of the CREW hold their breath, sensing a moment. Instead, CAPTAIN DALY lowers his phaser, sucks in air thr his teeth, gives an apologetic head shake.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Killing in cold blood is against the Space Fleet code. I wish I could help. CAPTAIN DALY kneels down, drops the hero act for a moment  30 31 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 43.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry. Bud. VALDACK looks like he could cry. The rest of the CREW loo away, each one with a strange look of defeat in their eye

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (To the crew) Take him to the brig. SHANIA and PACKER help VALDACK up, drag him away as CAPTA DALY hails the CALLISTER with his omnicorder.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dudani.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: (From ship) Captain.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Transport us aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another feverish round of For He's a Jolly Good Fellow is taking place as DALY basks in his latest achievement. He takes SHANIA in his arms, and does the damsel-kiss. Next it's TULASKA's turn. Then - as the singing continues he pulls NANETTE close and leans in to kiss her. NANETTE pushes him away. Slaps him. The SINGING stops:

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: And so say - oh my fuck DALY holds his cheek. Glares at NANETTE. An ominous pause

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: That wasn't very nice. He rises up, holds out his hand like the Emperor again. T crew holds its breath. Nanette braces herself. Then suddenly, DALY lowers his arm. CAPTAIN DALY (CONT’D) Today I will show you mercy.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: Great mercy-showing Captain.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: (ignoring that) Tomorrow, you should reconsider your... amenability. I may not be feeling so benevolent. (Out loud) Exit game. CAPTAIN DALY instantly disappears. The ship goes into sta mode, the lights dim, leaving just the CREW. A beat, then

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: (sigh of relief) Fucking hell.

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: This was tense. (annoyed glance at

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: I don’t like tense.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CREW sit by the area where WALTON runs his 'bar'. He' filling DUDANI and TULASKA in on what happened on the gro

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Wasn't too bad. Usual ‘standoff’ storyline. (beat) Saw Gillian from Marketing. NANETTE is pacing up and down.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: No way I'm kissing that asshole.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: Then he’s gonna get more and more pissed-

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: (back at PACKER) How about you kiss him?

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: Look, it’s -- you get used to it. (beat) There’s no tongues, never tongues, if that’s any consolation-- NANETTE grimaces.  32 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 45.

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: Doing tongues is not "Space Fleet way".

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: - and it's not like it can get beyond kissing anyway.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: You haven’t noticed? WALTON clears his throat, steps out from behind the 'bar' calmly starts undoing the belt on his costume.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Okay what’re -- He unbuttons his pants -- NANETTE is appalled:

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't do that -- He drops his pants, revealing -- nothing! Where his genit should be there's a smooth, hairless mound. Like a Ken do

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: No genitals in Space Fleet. It’s a wholesome universe. NANETTE looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: He must’ve modified our code that way. Think he’s scared of sex. (beat) We're all the same. Don't believe me, take a look down there. She points at NANETTE’s groin. NANETTE gingerly pulls the waist of her skirt away from her belly and peers down int her knickers. Her face says it all. WALTON, doing up his pants, adds:

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: We've tried grinding our mounds together out of sheer boredom, no sensation at all.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: Can’t even shit. Can’t even have the basic fucking pleasure of pushing out a shit.  USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 46.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They all nod, sadly.

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: I miss taking shit.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Okay. Stealing my pussy is a red fucking line. We gotta get this bastard.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: We've tried a million times. No way out.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Walton, c’mon- Walton! WALTON downs his shot, walks off to sulk in a corner. NAN watches him go, shaking her head.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Daly's smart. But he’s not a God. He's a coder. He's fallible. (A flash of inspiration) Kabir! What was he holding? In his hand, that scanner thing?

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: His omnicorder. Primary communications device--

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: (to SHANTIA) You said he kept his version of the game offline. SHANIA nods.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to DUDANT) But his omnicorder made contact with the outside world. When the pizza came. Gotta be connected to his home system at least.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: The omnicorder’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: It loads when he loads, it goes when he goes. And that's the only one. NANETTE thinks. Walks over to one of the ship's computers It's displaying apparently random code raining down the screen. A bit MATRIX.  32 33 34

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: There's got be a way to connect. She starts typing.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: You won't hack it. I've tried.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: I haven't. 17 47. 32 She types furiously. DUDANI shakes his head and walks off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOURS PASS -- during which we see an EXTERIOR SHOT of the CALLISTER with the HEAVENS rolling past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANETTE is typing furiously. Suddenly she stops.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Bingo. DUDANI and SHANIA are nearby. She shows them the screen. An icon of a handshake, beneath it the words INVITE A FRIEND DUDANI's eyes widen as the penny drops.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: Oh that’s good. SHANIA still looks confused, so Nanette explains:

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Part of Infinity's front end. You invite a friend with a custom message.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: You can get a message to outside?

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Just one. 140 characters maximum.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: Who are you going to contact? NANETTE flashes a smile.  35 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANETTE, stands in the elevator listening to her ear buds exits into CALLISTER inc's LOBBY... ... which is now festooned with CHRISTMAS DECORATIONS. Even ELENA the RECEPTIONIST wears novelty antlers as she fiddles with her smartphone.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Hey Elena. As NANETTE passes toward the office she hears her phone P It’s an email. ROBERT DALY INVITES YOU TO JOIN INFINITY. NANETTE opens the e-mail and stands reading for a moment. Beneath the 'SIGN UP NOW' icon is a message; THIS IS NOT SPAM. DALY HAS STOLEN YOUR IDENTITY. I AM YOU AND I'M TRAPPED IN MODDED INFINITY.

dialogues.speaker: HELP ME. CONTACT CYBER POL
dialogues.text: NANETTE reads the message, thoroughly confused. Elena assumes there's a problem with her pass.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: You need me buzz you in?

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Wh - oh. No - uh. She puts her phone away and looks for her pass. KARL appe from behind, and proffers his own.

dialogues.speaker: KARL
dialogues.text: I’ll get that for you

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: KARL
dialogues.text: After you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More decorations. NANETTE heads across the floor, still slightly thinking about the email. Looking at her phone.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She sees Robert Daly walking ahead of her.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Mr Daly, hi. He looks up. A bit flustered.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: Uh, hey.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: You didn't send me an Infinity invite just now did you?

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: What? No. What?

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: It was really weird, it had this message attached, about people "trapped in the game". DALY thinks fast.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: Probably a spambot, firewall doesn't always get them all.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: That's what I thought. Weirdest thing. It went to my personal account, not my work mail.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: Hackers getting creative. I wouldn't worry about it. Didn't open the link did you?

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: God, no.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: Maybe upgrade your security software I guess.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Well. Have a good one. She turns and heads back to her desk. Daly passes WALTON’s OFFICE, peering in. Walton is walkin around casually strumming an unplugged ELECTRIC GUITAR. Daly glowers.  37 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTON is methodically banging his head on a desk. Slowly Bang. Pause. Bang. Pause. Bang. Pause. Eventually:

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: Could you cut that out?

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Trying to make it a hobby. Suddenly the LIGHTS turn up - the HUM of the ship waking

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: This is way too early. He's only been at work a few hours.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: She got the message. I did. It's me. Or the cops most likely. (Smiles) We're getting out of here. SHANIA looks less convinced. They look at the DOOR -- as it slides open... to reveal CAPTAIN DALY. Glowering. NANETTE glances at the CREW. This is bad. DALY walks to the DISPLAY SCREEN and gazes out into space

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: What is Space Fleet? (Dark, quiet) I‘1l tell you what it is. It's a belief system, founded on the very best of human nature. It's a goal for us to strive towards, for the betterment of the universe, the betterment of life itself. He turns to face them. CAPTAIN DALY (CONT’D) (petulant rage) And you assholes are fucking it up! NANETTE steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: It was me. I sent the message. No one else was involved, I swear. CAPTAIN DALY stares at her.  37 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 51.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: I tried the carrot. Now meet the stick. DALY raises his hand, emperor-style. SHANIA looks worried NANETTE turns defiant.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: None of this is ever gonna make you happy, Daly. Cos you're sick. You're sick and you need to get help. DALY stretches out his hand. SHANIA has to intervene.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: Don't! (beat) Captain. Please. She’s new. She’1l behave. We’ll all behave. Just -- let her off. Just this once. DALY thinks. He lowers his hand.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Okay. He smiles. And then aims his hand at SHANIA.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: No -- no - Too late. DALY concentrates -- and SHANIA starts to convu She SCREAMS in AGONY and drops to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please no! Daly no! SHANIA mutates into an ARACHNAJAX. The metamorphosis is agonising. Her SCREAMS become more animal, guttural. NANETTE looks at CAPTAIN DALY, coldly looking back at her the ARACHNAJAX ROARS out in PAIN.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Know what makes me happy? The look on your face right now. He turns to the rest of the CREW. CAPTAIN DALY (CONT’D) (about ARACHNAJAX) Dudani, Walton, Tulaska -- throw that thing in the brig with Valdack. Packer, find a barren planet we can dump her on. (turns to NANETTE) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 37 38 39 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 52.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN DALY (CONT’D) And you. You can just stay here. Think about your attitude. The crew glumly set about their tasks, DUDANI and co shepherding SHANIA / ARACHNAJAX to the brig while PACKER to his navigation computer. CAPTAIN DALY (CONT’D) Exit game. He vanishes. NANETTE sits down, defeated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANETTE stands by the window, staring out into DEEP SPACE She’s CRYING. Utterly broken. But then something catches her eye. Out the window, in th depths of space - a LIGHT. Something is happening. She wipes the tears and snot on her sleeve, looks out to OUT IN SPACE -- A cluster of stars swirl together, suckin debris from around them - forming a funnel shape... A WORMHOLE IS FORMING IN SPACE in the distance. She looks at the access panel screen beside the window. I kicks into life. Incomprehensible data scrolling down the screen. NANETTE studies it. It's code! She realizes what's happen

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: (To herself) Update patch. (beat; louder) The update patch! She RUNS toward the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANETTE is beside PACKER, as he looks at a GALACTIC MAP o his display. The WORMHOLE is depicted on it, a distance a NANETTE taps the WORMHOLE.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: So what. It's a wormhole. The doors slide open, the remainder of the CREW slouch in

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Uh-uh. It's the Christmas update patch, pre-installing itself. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The wormhole is just how the game's expressing the uplink.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: So? DUDANI understands what’s happening.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: So Daly’s custom build is still connected to the internet.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: (nodding) Some way, somehow -- WALTON cuts in.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: If this is another one of your '‘plans', just stop now before someone else gets monster-fied--

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: This can work.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: But we can't get online access from the ship, he’1ll have crippled permissions.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Yes, but -- what happens if we fly into the wormhole?

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: Like on purpose? DUDANI has worked it out. His eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: We'd hit the system firewall -- and have our rogue coding deleted.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: Deleted as in--?

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: - as in die.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: Whether it’s ‘dying’ would depend largely on your philosophical position regarding sentient co- 53. 39

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: (cutting in) We would cease to exist. That’s true. But we'd be free. (beat) We'd be free. The CREW go quiet. Think about what she's saying.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: But this is academic since we have no means of getting to the wormhole-

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: Yeah we can only pilot the damn thing while Daly's here. He'll stop us like that. NANETTE thinks.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: How about when he's logged in but on pause? Like when his pizza came? He was just frozen there-

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: Flying would be possible-- (nodding at map) -- but that wormhole's a whole parsec away; we'd never reach it before he got back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANETTE nods. Thinking.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Unless we can stall him longer.

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: And that we do how?

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: We'd need help from outside. From real me again.

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: Worked good last time...

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: How we meant to contact "real you" again anyhow?

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: (to DUDANT) If we can get Daly's omnicorder, we can make a call, right?  USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 55.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: That’s correct, theoretically, but--

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Well, if we can get real me on the phone, I may have some... leverage.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: Leverage on yourself?

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. They stare blankly at her.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: (almost reluctant) My PhotoCloud account. I know the password - obviously. There're some... interesting images in there. That I shoulda deleted a while back. But didn’t. (beat; deep breath) So we can blackmail me. Pretty sure I'd do anything to stop those pictures getting out.

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: Must be pretty pictures.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Look if this is gonna work, we've all gotta be in on it. There’s a pause while they consider..

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: Flying into certain death in a wormhole beats another 10,000 years with Captain Ass. I'm in.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: Me too. They look at TULASKA.

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
