dialogues.text: Also me. WALTON suddenly pipes up from across the room.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Well I'm out  USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 56.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They stare at him. WALTON (CONT’D) Daly's won. We just gotta get on with it. We don't have a chance. NANETTE rounds on him.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Yes we do. We hit that wormhole, we're extinct. Gone. Rid of his shit.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: (bitterly) Sounds peachy. NANETTE gets closer.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: What's with you? Don't you wanna fight back? Why won't you fight back?

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Tommy . No-one knows what he's talking about.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Who's Tommy?

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: My son. He's six years old. Least he was when I woke up in here. (beat) See, in the early days of this ship, it was just me and Daly in here. I was his pet project. He tried just about everything to break me. I withstood it all. Cos I thought there was still a chance I could get out. See my boy again. (beat) And I was right. I did get to see him again. Just not the real him. As WALTON continues to speak we see GLIMPSES from the PAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow-mo, dreamlike. We see REAL WALTON showing his son TO round the office. Greeting KARL, DUDANI (AWKWARDLY), NATE SHANIA gives TOMMY a RED LOLLIPOP. He starts SUCKING it.  40 4l 42 43 44 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 57.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Daly told me what happened. Back in the outside, real me brought Tommy into the office one day. Wanted to show him around. He would’ve loved seeing all the computers, he's into that stuff. (beat) Anyhow evidently, Tommy had a lollipop that day. TOMMY puts the LOLLIPOP down on a desk absent-mindedly. P focus to see DALY looking at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see DALY removing the LOLLIPOP from a PLASTIC BAG with TWEEZERS, placing it in his PETRI DISH DEVICE.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That was all Daly needed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In slow-mo, CAPTAIN DALY leads TOMMY onto the BRIDGE. WAL is the only other crew member. His face lights up, but he also concerned.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He copied him into here. And it was Tommy alright. Alike in every way. CAPTAIN DALY grabs hold of TOMMY before he can run to his Suddenly we're back in the present, on the BRIDGE -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walton's voice is cracking. Nanette is silenced, listenin

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: You know what he did to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow-mo still as CAPTAIN DALY drags a screaming TOMMY dow the corridor, towards the AIRLOCK with the ACCESS PANEL.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He took Tommy and he threw him out the airlock. Right out into space. Made me watch.  44 45 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 58.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We see WALTON staring out of the window, screaming and howling in slow motion, horrified by what he can see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTON is in tears now.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Have you ever seen an unsuited body compress in space? They freeze. And crack. Like a porcelain doll. I take my hat off to Daly, the detail in this place really is exceptional. Everyone is stunned. Horrified.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He said he'd do it again. And again. If he had to. (beat) I can't let him do that to Tommy. Never again. (beat) Daly's still got his DNA. Got all our DNA. He told me. Keeps it ina bedroom mini-fridge by his desk. So I have to stay in line. (beat) Because even if we all die, he can bring us back. He can bring Tommy back -- whenever he wants. And God knows how he'd take it out on him. God knows what he'd do. But I tell you this. He’d make us watch.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: (tears in his eyes) So you see? What choice do I have? (breaking down) What choice? NANETTE is closest. She holds him. And then she looks him the eye with all the conviction she can muster and she sa

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Walton. We are gonna get that fucking lollipop. (beat) But you gotta believe me. Can you do that? Can you? He looks at her, uncertain.  46 47 48 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We notice a uniform CHRISTMAS WREATH on the door, as the house lights up as DALY enters and heads to his bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once inside, DALY sits down at his games desk. There’s now a slightly pathetic mini-CHRISTMAS TREE on it Grabs a chocolate milk from his fridge. We see the LOLLIP and the other DNA bags. He slurps, pops the VR DISC on his temple. Boots up the g An LED flashes. His eyes mist over. He goes limp. He's in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN DALY bounds in. And smiles as he sees NANETTE is sitting dutifully at the COMMS desk.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: (to NANETTE) Good to see you at your position Cole.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: (saluting) Captain - you've come at just the right time.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: I have?

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: (nod) I'm picking up a distress signal from the surface of Skillane IV. Looks like a crashed shuttle. (beat) What should we do?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Space Fleet never turns its back on those who need our help. Dudani, set a course for Skillane IV --

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: Aye aye sir  48 49 50 51 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 60.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: We'll send a search party. (beat; turning round) Packer, Tulaska --

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: (cutting in) Actually Captain - I was thinking maybe you could take me alone. As science officer I need to learn the ropes. And I could use your close attention. DALY is flustered. It takes him a while to respond.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANETTE and CAPTAIN DALY transport down onto a warm, crag planet surface. Arid mountains, lush lakes. DALY takes out his omnicorder, scans the area. NANETTE ey the device hungrily.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Atmosphere's good. Daly spots the SHUTTLE up ahead. It's the size of a miniv CAPTAIN DALY (CONT’D) Over there. He leads the way. Behind, NANETTE exhales. So far so good

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CREW are gathered around DUDANI's control panel, watc a wireframe map with a GPS dot on it, indicating DALY and NANETTE’s position. They're waiting for something. We tur see their faces as we hear DALY saying:

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No signs of life here. Shuttle is deserted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN DALY and NANETTE stand a short distance from the SHUTTLE. DALY is talking into the omnicorder. There is a shimmering LAKE nearby. NANETTE looks at it and thinks.  51 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 61.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: We'll scout the area, check for any life forms. Daly out. NANETTE starts walking toward the lake. DALY looks confus CAPTAIN DALY (CONT’D) Cole, we should head out this way. (beat) Cole? NANETTE unzips her uniform, slipping it off (she wears a sports bra and underwear beneath). CAPTAIN DALY averts his eyes -- then stops averting them. CAPTAIN DALY (CONT’D) Wh- what are you doing? NANETTE swims in up to her neck and turns around, smiling

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Ohmygod the water's great. DALY’s flustered. He's simultaneously annoyed and mesmeri

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on in!

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Swimming's a leisure activity. We're on Space Fleet duty. NANETTE dives and resurfaces, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: We could always say I started drowning. You had to come in to rescue me... (beat) Come on in, my big Captain... DALY thinks. He's shy but wants to join her. He starts slipping off his clothes too (he has boxers on beneath). DALY carefully folds his clothes and lays them on the gro Puts the omnicorder on top of them and heads in to the wa

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (smiling) Gonna take all day? As DALY walks toward the water, smiling at NANETTE, we se the omnicorder start to GLOW. It's being TELEPORTED...  52 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The omnicorder re-appears on the bridge. DUDANI scoops it as the rest of the crew look on anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: Okay, gotta patch it in. DUDANI sits the omnicorder on his workstation panel, a connecting circle appears beneath it. He's in. Everyone looks up to the main bridge screen, which now displays a search engine page. DUDANI navigates to the LO page of NANETTE'S PhotoCloud account.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It worked. I'm connected. Gonna access her photocloud account.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: You actually remember that password?

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: (from memory) Uppercase Y 998 lowercase g-p-7 Uppercase TY ampersand 4. (adding approvingly as he types it in) Secure choice. The screen switches to an iPhoto style GALLERY of Nanette personal photos. Pretty innocuous stuff so far.

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: Boring life. Everyone's staring at them as DUDANI scrolls down.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: There's a thousand images here. This could take a while to find-- DUDANI focuses on his workstation. Then as they scroll do we watch the crew's faces. We see a picture of NANETTE grinning in a swanky hotel ro Taking a selfie in the bathroom mirror. Then another one her shoulder strap is down. And another -- Everyone reacts -- eyes widening at what they're seeing.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: Woah. Even TULASKA is momentarily impressed. She cranes her nec  52 53 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 63.

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: That is gymnastic physique.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Nice... bedding. PACKER swallows like he's seeing the face of God. There's pause as they all stare mesmerised.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: Should I keep scrolling? After a while of watching, wide eyed.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: I'd say any of the last nine will do.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: (swallowing) Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a desk in the corner real DUDANI sits typing into his system. Not far away the real NANETTE sits at her workstation, also working late. Earbuds in. SHANIA heads past, heading out for the holidays. She playfully bounces a stress ball off NANETTE’s head as she approaches. NANETTE pops out her earbuds.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Thank you. Going out for the night?

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: Hello, it’s Christmas Eve. Out of this place for like ten days. (beat) You'll fuse with that desk, go home.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: I will, just gotta finish off...

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: Well okay. Merry Christmas loser. NANETTE smiles. SHANIA leaves. NANETTE’s about to put the earbuds back in when her phone PINGS. Message from ANONYM She looks confused, taps it open.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE COLE. REMEMBER THAT WEEK IN VEGAS
dialogues.text: NANETTE'S eyes widen. She seems to know what that means.  53 54 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 64.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Then a PHOTO MESSAGE arrives. The bathroom mirror SELFIE. NANETTE reacts, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Oh God, Elliot you asshole. Another message appears. Another image with the headline; PS - THIS ISN'T ELLIOT. She frowns -- then the phone RINGS in her hand: ANONYMOUS NANETTE lets it ring for a moment. Shock and panic overri everything. Then she answers it, to hear a gravelly voice We INTERCUT with the BRIDGE to show WALTON saying the following into a mic, with a hand over his mouth to make voice sound mysterious:

dialogues.speaker: WALTON, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Nanette Cole. We have hacked your PhotoCloud account.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Who is this? What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: WALTON, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Do exactly as instructed or first thing Christmas Morning your entire gallery will be shared with your friends and family. (beat) And PornHub. (At that last line we see TULASKA looking at WALTON unimpressed. He shrugs -- he thought it was a nice touch. A beat; fear in NANETTE'S eyes. She gulps. Holds her brow

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Okay. Whatever you want. I'll do anything. Just -- I'll do anything.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Then listen to our instructions carefully. There isn't much time. Get your coat on. (beat) Now! REAL NANETTE jerks to attention and immediately stands up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALY bobs beside NANETTE. He glances back to the shore.  54 55 56 57 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 65.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: We should probably head back --

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: (hurriedly) Help I’m drowning! He whips his head back round.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, it's okay. Just - forgot how to swim for a moment. Haha! DALY smiles awkwardly at her. She's acting a little odd. Then she splashes him playfully with water. DALY’s almost angry. Then he smiles -- he smiles -- and splashes her ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real NANETTE climbs over a BALCONY -- nervously -- and on safe, peeks into DALY'S WINDOW. She sees him lying limp i his chair, plugged into the game, but his BACK is to her.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: (into earpiece) In position. INTERCUT with the BRIDGE of the USS CALLISTER:

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: OK. We’ll hang up now. Make the call and do not fail the rest of your mission.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: I will --

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: You better. WALTON taps the omnicorder off and hands it to DUDANI.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: Okay, send it back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As DALY and NANETTE frolic in the water, the omnicorder rematerialises on top of his pile of clothing.  57 58 59 60 61 62 63 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 66.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DALY bobs underwater for a moment. A quick glimpse of NANETTE's smile fading - then reappearing as he resurface EXT. DALY’S APARTMENT - BALCONY - NIGHT 58 Real NANETTE makes a phonecall. Adjusts her earpiece.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: (On phone) Yeah, I'd like to order a pizza. INT. DALY’S APARTMENT BLOCK - HALLWAY - LATER 59 A PIZZA GUY arrives. Checks it’s 102. Pushes a buzzer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DISPLAY PANEL by the DOOR goes BING BONG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As NANETTE and DALY splash each other, laughing, on the shore, DALY's omnicorder lights up and emit the same BING BONG sound as the doorbell. Both he and NANETTE look round.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Guess you better get that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALY lies limp in the chair, eyes glazed, as the bing-bon continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALY, still in his BOXERS, grabs the omnicorder. Looks at

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: It's the door. (beat) Pause game. He's frozen in position. NANETTE quickly grabs the omnico from his hand, taps something and speaks into it.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Dudani? Pick me up.  63 64 65 66 67 68 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 67.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She chucks the omnicorder down onto DALY’s clothes, gathe her own clothes and starts to DEMATERIALISE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .-. And REMATERIALISES on the bridge, still in underwear, clutching her clothes.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Okay. We don't have much time. She quickly starts to dress. Her and PACKER share a glanc for a moment -- PACKER looks away -- he's embarrassed. NANETTE briefly remembers the photos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALY snaps out of the game, takes off the VR DISC and pla it on his DESK. The BING BONG noise continues.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: Coming! EXT. DALY’S APARTMENT BLOCK - BALCONY - CONTINUOUS 66 REAL NANETTE watches through the glass as DALY heads for door. As soon as he's gone, she OPENS THE BALCONY DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALY stands by the door. He talks into the CONTROL PANEL.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: PIZZA DELIVERY GUY, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Pizza.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: I didn't order pizza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quietly, REAL NANETTE sneaks up to DALY's desk, picks up VR EXPERIENCER DISC, puts it in a pocket and REPLACES IT AN IDENTICAL COPY. Then she quickly opens the MINI-FRIDGE and looks at the LOLLIPOP BAG. She stares at it, bemused for a moment --  USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 68.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: (hushed) The hell am I doing? -- then stuffs it -- AND THE OTHER BAGS - in her pocket. She quickly fishes her phone out and TAPS something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANETTE is quickly dressing, while on the main screen, a chart is on display. WALTON is plotting a course. Suddenly there’s a DING and a large NOTIFICATION on the screen. FRIEND INVITE ACCEPTED! From NANETTE COLE

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: That’s the signal! She’s got the

dialogues.speaker: DNA
dialogues.text: (beat) All of it. Tommy too. She looks at WALTON, who is relieved beyond belief.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (To PACKER) Packer, we ready to fly?

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: You're supposed to say something like 'engage' or ‘increase thru--

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Just fucking go. PACKER nods, engages thrusters. The ship speeds into SPAC

dialogues.speaker: PIZZA DELIVERY GUY
dialogues.text: Man someone ordered it. You want it or not?

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: Hold on.  70 71 72 73 74 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 69.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DALY opens the door. He takes the pizza, beeps a CONTACTL CARD onto the pizza guy's PAYMENT WIDGET.

dialogues.speaker: DALY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: PIZZA DELIVERY GUY
dialogues.text: Hey, I got it here in under twenty. (beat) There's supposed to be thirty in it for me. DALY looks at him blankly for a moment, then shuts the do

dialogues.speaker: PIZZA DELIVERY GUY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the fuck asshole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The real NANETTE hears the door shut. She FREEZES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALY takes a slice, pleased with his bounty. Tucks in. The digital doorbell BLEEPS. We see on the control panel PIZZA DELIVERY GUY still at the door. Demanding his tip.

dialogues.speaker: PIZZA DELIVERY GUY
dialogues.text: Come on man you promised... DALY taps the screen. Selects DO NOT DISTURB mode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the PIZZA DELIVERY GUY's dismay, the little SCREEN wit the APARTMENT NUMBER ON IT changes to read DO NOT DISTURB There's an auto-locking sound. PIZZA GUY tries the DOORBELL again but now it’s SILENT. A beat. Then he gives up.

dialogues.speaker: PIZZA DELIVERY GUY
dialogues.text: Nice. Merry Christmas asshole! He turns and stomps away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALY enters his bedroom, chewing a slice of pizza. He loo around. Something odd, perhaps?  74 75 76 77 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 70.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He looks at the window. Walks over to it. EXT. DALY’S APARTMENT BLOCK - BALCONY - CONTINUOUS 75 REAL NANETTE ducks down so he can't see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALY draws the curtains shut and walks back to his desk. He sits down, picks up the VR DISC. Puts it on his temple

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: Resume game. Nothing. He peels the DISC off and blows on it.

dialogues.speaker: DALY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Resume game. Still nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the DISPLAY, stars whizz past. But NANETTE is anxious.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Can't we go any faster? That dud disc isn’t gonna fool him forever. Update's gonna complete before long and that means bye bye wormhole. PACKER points at his galactic map, showing the route.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: Only quicker route would be through that asteroid belt there.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: So let's go that way!

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: It's way too dense.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: If the ship broke up we wouldn't die, we'd just be left spinning in space-—  77 78 79 80 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 71.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: - until Daly works out what's happening. He'd find us and fuck us over. NANETTE nods, still impatient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having inspected it, DALY gives up with the VR DISC.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: Stupid thing. He TOSSES it across the room, opens a drawer. Rustles thr bric-a-brac, old paperclips and the like. At the back he finds a BRAND NEW VR DISC in SHRINK WRAPPED tasteful packaging. (It’s a small box -- about the size of the lit square case a pair of Apple earbuds comes in - NB maybe i a TCKR-branded product?) He RIPS it open. Quick cuts as fumbles and puts the new D on his temple.

dialogues.speaker: DALY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Resume game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN DALY, still in his underwear, suddenly springs in life. He’s confused for a moment by the lack of an omnico in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Okay Lt. Cole, let's head for-- (beat) Cole? He looks around. Where is she? He scoops up his OMNICORDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TULASKA sits up as DALY's VOICE comes through on a speake

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Daly to bridge. What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Shit. He had a backup disc. (to TULASKA) Don't answer him!  81 82 83 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 72.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: Come in? (beat) Goddamnit. He looks around. Spots the SHUTTLE in the distance. Trudg towards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DUDANI notes something on his display.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. The wormhole. It's decreasing in size.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Upload must be in the last few percent. Dammit Packer, we're gonna have to go through the belt. (beat) Think you can do it?

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: Think I can try. They watch anxiously as the DISPLAY swerves to show the ASTEROID BELT.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. SHUTTLE
dialogues.text: On the ALIEN PLANET, CAPTAIN DALY is inside the SHUTTLE. taps a few buttons on the dash. Systems hum into life.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Ships. Computer. On.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Computer, where is the USS Callister?

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: USS Callister is on course.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: On course for where?

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: The wormhole. A beat.  83 84 85

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: What wormhole?

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: The update vortex. A penny drops. Woah. WOAH.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Sons of bitches. (beat) Prepare for takeoff. He hits some controls. The engines start up.
83 84 The CALLISTER swerves through the ASTEROID BELT, narrowly avoiding calamity. A small ROCK bounces off the hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CREW lean THIS WAY and THAT, as PACKER pilots them between spinning chunks of space rock.

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: Shields at 86 percent. Suddenly DUDANI notes something on his computer.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: I’ve got a heat signature. Looks like a shuttle just took off from Skillane IV.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Daly.

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: Incoming transmission. 85 She hits a button and we INTERCUT with CAPTAIN DALY, spea into a handset on board the SHUTTLE, which is now in spac

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: I know you can hear me. Whatever you think you're going to do won't work. But it is going to cost you.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: (to PACKER) Let's go faster!

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: We're already at maximum.  85 86 87 88 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 74.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: Daly can't touch us unless he makes it on board. And that shuttle's a jalopy. He won't catch us in time.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: I hope you're right. Just then -- CLONG! Another small asteroid collides with ship. The crew rock about a little more.

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: Shields 58 percent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALY's SHUTTLE is whizzing through the inky dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALY continues hurling insults at them:

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: If you thought what has happened to you in the past was bad, that was nothing. What I'm going to do you is going to be god damn biblical...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALY's voice echoes round the BRIDGE as PACKER continues weave through the rocks.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'm going to literally turn your insides out, but I'll keep you alive, in jars--

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Why are we listening to this? TULASKA nods, hits a button. DALY's rant is cut off.

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: Yes fuck him.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: We're at the edge of the belt... I think we're gonna make it... Nanette smiles.  89 90 91 92 93 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spoke too soon. Just as the CALLISTER exits the astero field, one ASTEROID collides with CALLISTER's hull. It di away, causing damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thump! Rumble! The crew is jerked around. Then:

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: Shields critical, 6 percent -- Suddenly there's a heavy groaning sound from the engines.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: (studying screen; worried) The primary drive. It’s not responding.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: I've lost all thrust! (beat) Engines not responding. (beat) We're drifting here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure enough, the ship is drifting in space. Powerless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship's computer announces:

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: USS Callister has lost engine power.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Coming to get you! He accelerates a little more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All hope is lost. No-one knows what to do.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: What do we do?  USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 76.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Everyone looks at NANETTE. She's in the captain's chair.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: I don't know... (to DUDANT) Any way we can fix the engines?

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: That's only feasible manually. By climbing inside the jet feeder.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: So --

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: So you'd burn to a crisp when the jet came on.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: You'd burn without dying.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Then one of us has to go. Sudden wide shot. WALTON isn't there. Suddenly - a voice:

dialogues.speaker: WALTON, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: One of us already has.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Walton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The JET FEEDER TUBE is a bit like the interior of a giant ENGINE. Dark and lots of pipes and stuff. WALTON is in there, with some TOOLS. Wrenching at somethi in the wiring. He now has a COMMS EARPIECE in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: (straining as he wrenches something) Pretty sure I can fix this...

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Walton, are you sure about this? WALTON keeps his eyes fixed on the task.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: I'm sure. (beat) Tulaska, can you patch me through to Daly?  95 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANETTE looks at TULASKA. She nods.

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: Patching through. INTERCUT ALL THREE -- the CREW on the BRIDGE as they list WALTON in the JET FEEDER and DALY in the SHUTTLE.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Daly? Can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Walton you're gonna pay for this --

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Robert, listen-

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: -- I'm gonna bring Tommy back in--

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: Robert --

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: And God so help me you’re gonna regret this all so hard--

dialogues.speaker: BOB I WANNA TALK TO YOU HERE
dialogues.text: DALY shuts up, momentarily chastened.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was thinking I should say sorry. As WALTON talks he continues tinkering with a space-spann

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: WALTON
dialogues.text: You created Infinity. You're a genius. I exploited that. Treated you like the golden goose. Got fat on the profits. (beat) Figuratively speaking. (beat) I was thinking I oughta say I should've appreciated you more. Shoulda treated you better. DALY doesn't speak for a moment -- this is touching him.  95 96 97 98 99 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 78.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WALTON (CONT’D) Yeah. I was thinking I should say all that. (beat) But you threw my son out of an airlock. So fuck you to death. And with that he WRENCHES something -- and the JET roars. WALTON is INCINERATED, SCREAMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTON's scream is cut off - the feed dies. ENGINES roar.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: We got power back! He YANKS a thruster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ENGINE roars -- and the ship HURTLES for the WORMHOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALY anxiously looks ahead. A little graphic display show his shuttle is GAINING on the USS CALLISTER.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Callister at 4Km and closing.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Faster!

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Speed already at maximum.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Whatever, just catch them!

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: Wormhole almost closed.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: (to PACKER) Keep her steady... PACKER sweats as he pilots the craft.  99 100 101 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 79.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Steady...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CALLISTER approaches the shrinking WORMHOLE... We INTERCUT with the CREW holding its breath:

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Steady... And with DALY, shouting:

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Come on! And with TULASKA saying:

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: I hope we are going to die. And then... The USS CALLISTER SLIPS INTO THE WORMHOLE - - Which WINKS SHUT BEHIND THEM. And DALY's SHUTTLE zips past, missing the aperture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wild, bright lights on the display. Like the Falcon going into HYPERSPACE. The CREW stand together. Looking into infinity. They slowly, silently HOLD HANDS in a final act of solidarity. The entire BRIDGE distorts. Elongates. SPINS. Strobe lighting. Impressionistic faces of the crew. Like the black hole segment in 2001: A Space Odyssey. And then -- BLACKNESS

dialogues.speaker: TOTAL BLACKNESS
dialogues.text: And then suddenly:  USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's changed. The bridge layout is the same, but t colour scheme is more MODERN. The display graphics are NOTABLY more HIGH-TECH. We have JJ ABRAMS LENS FLARE. Even the CREW COSTUMES are more MODERN. The women's outfi less revealing. They look down at themselves.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: What's happened?

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: The mod's gone. Daly's Space Fleet mod. It's been stripped away by the firewall. They glance at TULASKA -- she’s HUMAN again! TULASKA look down at her own skin.

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: Okay so this is good.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: We're still alive? DUDANI looks at his display.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: Yeah it only erased the Space Fleet mod.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: We're not on Daly's computer any more. (beat) We're in the cloud. But TULASKA looks worried.

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: Where's Daly? DUDANI looks at his display.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: Firewall's deleted his rogue gamecode. And his controls are disabled.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: You mean --? DUDANI nods, with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: He's stuck there.  103 104 105 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALY's SHUTTLE thrums through space. Suddenly -- the stars start to disappear. All of them. Rapidly twinkling out of existence.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Update complete. Wormhole closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daly frantically punches buttons.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Controls are disabled.

dialogues.speaker: DALY
dialogues.text: No no no-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CREW sit on the BRIDGE, looking at the universe. Just then they hear the DOOR OPEN and a triumphant voice:

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: Arseholes! They spin around. SHANIA and VALDACK have just entered. K is now in INFINITY COSTUME, as are the rest of the crew.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Brig unlocked itself.

dialogues.speaker: KARL
dialogues.text: My Valdack outfit turned into this!

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: Yeah Karl, more to the point I’m not a fucking beetle thing anymore. (beat) Got my body back, I mean my full body back. Guessing we all did. PACKER thinks. Peers inside his own PANTS. And grins like man who's discovered his penis now exists again after a l period of absence. Because that's what has happened.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: So what do we do now?  105 106 107 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 82.

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: We've got an infinite procedurally generated universe at our disposal. We can go anywhere. NANETTE gazes at the heavens on the monitor, awestruck.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Holy mackerel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALY notices it's getting darker. He's worried.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Rogue universe detected... Deletion in process...

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: No! NO! Undelete! UNDELETE!

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: (voice slowing down) My mind is going... I can feel it.. The COMPUTER falls silent. The lights in the SHUTTLE dim.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DALY
dialogues.text: Exit game. Nothing. CAPTAIN DALY (CONT’D) Exit game! A penny drops. He panics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The REAL DALY sits LIMP in the chair. EYES GLAZED. Mouth slightly open. Unable to move. The VR disc on his temple. The mini Christmas tree glows in the dark. We slowly drif away...  108 109 110 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 83. INT. DALY’S APARTMENT BLOCK - HALLWAY - CONTINUOUS 108 We pull away from DALY's APARTMENT DOOR with its Christma wreath -— - past the screen that reads;

dialogues.speaker: DO NOT DISTURB
dialogues.text: And pull further out to see... EXT. DALY’S APARTMENT BLOCK - CONTINUOUS 109 «+. the entire building. Snow swirling. Sleighbells tinkl Passers-by walking past, oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TULASKA sees something on a monitor.

dialogues.speaker: TULASKA
dialogues.text: Incoming transmission! They all spin to look at her. TULASKA (CONT’D) It says Gamer691 --

dialogues.speaker: DUDANI
dialogues.text: That’s... a playertag. Another ship. Another player --

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: We're online. Patch them through! She nods and taps something.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello! Hey! This is the crew of the USS Callister. Man, are we glad to-- She's cut off by the sound of an obnoxious 13-year old BO

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGER, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Yeah, Merry Christmas, so are we gonna blow each other or are we gonna trade?

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Um-— NANETTE opens her mouth, to be cut off again--  USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 84.

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGER
dialogues.text: Hello-o? Do you have anything to trade at all?

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: No, uh-

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGER
dialogues.text: So why did you respond? OK just get the hell out of my quadrant or I’1l blast you to shit. You got ten seconds.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: (yelling at TEEN) Oh do try -- we’ll photon bolt you right up the perineum, you stupid little boy.

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGER
dialogues.text: Five seconds!

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: Come on then. NANETTE sees this is going to get out of control.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Okay Nate-- uh Helmsman Packer

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGER, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Five...

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: Yes Captain?

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGER, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Four.

dialogues.speaker: SHANIA
dialogues.text: This kid--

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Stick us in hyperwarp and lets - fuck off somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGER, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Three.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: Aye aye, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: NANETTE
dialogues.text: Really, Nanette's fine.

dialogues.speaker: PACKER
dialogues.text: Aye aye, Nanette.  110 111 USS CALLISTER. SHOOTING SCRIPT. 06.01.17 85.

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGER, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Two. INT. DEEP SPACE - CONTINUOUS ll. The USS CALLISTER fires up its hyperwarp engines and ZIPS out of view leaving behind the HECTORING VOICE of GAMER 6

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGER, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: - One! Uh huh, you better run! King of space, right here. (beat) King of space.
